description: Artificial intelligence is an extremely broad field in which the overarching goal is the creation
of an autonomous agent with human-level capabilities.  Students study the fundamental
algorithms and techniques used to create agents with varying degrees of autonomy and function,
including search algorithms, first-order logic, Bayesian networks and simple neural networks.
Students learn how to represent problems for specific techniques, and how to select the best
technique for a given problem. Prerequisites: CSCI 251 and MATH 234, or permission of instructor.
